BC-DOGS-TIPS30-COX 
    

      Tips for selecting a dog
      (EDS: Runs with DOGS30-COX.)
      Staff report
      c. 1998 Cox News Service

   _ Never pick one just because it is cute.

   _ Try to meet the pup's parents; don't buy from a pet store.

   _ Spend at least a couple of hours with a pup you like. If
necessary, go back and visit it several times.

   _ Don't pick a dog as a fashion statement.

   _ Factor in size and activity level. The most common complaints
are from people who pick a dog that's too active, not active enough
or too large for their living space.

   _ Consider whether your personality and lifestyle are compatible
with a dog's characteristics.

   Story Filed By Cox Newspapers

   For Use By Clients of the New York Times News Service
